docs.lead_paragraph: Tantalizing hints have begun to appear that the worst of the crack epidemic is waning. A few unexpected bright spots, for example, now illuminate New York City's social landscape: fewer children are going into foster care; crime reports are going down and so are hospital emergencies. There's a hopeful trend here for the country: Finally, crack cocaine use seems to be declining. It's a trend that opens promising opportunities for long-neglected drug treatment programs to shrink the remaining pool of hard-core addicts, if only Government would respond.
